name: meretriciously
content:
meretriciously adverb
(FALSELY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that seems attractive but is really false or of little value: Advertising has always been a meretriciously self-obsessed business. The bill is complex, and its opponents say it is meretriciously muddled.

meretriciously adverb
(RELATIONSHIP)
old use If two people live meretriciously, they have a sexual relationship without being married to each other: Both parties entered into the original union meretriciously. He had been living with her for fifteen years meretriciously, and married her about three months before his death.
More examplesFewer examplesThey had begun their cohabitation meretriciously.Where the relationship began meretriciously, the claimant had to show the existence of a marriage.
